div1.head: Letter from Chauncey B. Baker to Jefferson Randolph Kean, April 15, 1935
div1.opener:
FROM GEN. J. R. KEAN
THE AMERICAN NATIONAL
FIRE INSURANCE COMPANY
COLUMBUS, OHIO
HOME OFFICE
50 WEST BROAD ST. COLUMBUS, OHIO
April 15, 1935
CHAUNCEY B. BAKER
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD
WILLIAM H. ROOF
PRESIDENT
ALEXANDER R. PHILLIPS
VICE-PRESIDENT
GERALD O. GREGORY
VICE-PRESIDENT
WILLIAM O. McLELLAND
VICE-PRESIDENT & SECRETARY
DANIEL W. ACKERMAN
VICE-PRESIDENT & SECRETARY
JOSEPH O. NIEDERLITZ
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
General Jefferson Randolph Kean
United States Medical Library
Office of the Journal Military Surgeon
United States Army
Washington, D. C.
My dear Ranny:
div1.p:
I am enclosing herewith a copy of a recital that I
gave at a recent meeting of the Board of Directors of this
Company, and at the request of the Secretary I dictated the
enclosed and he has sent copies out to various interested
persons. I sent a copy to Truby at Walter Reed, and at his
suggestion I am sending a copy to you. I have been obliged
to put myself into this paper rather conspicuously, as it
was a personal recital, so you will, I am sure, overlook
what might appear to a stranger rather too much personal
injection.

I think of you very, very often; in fact, the more
years I leave you behind, the more intimately I think of
those who worked along with me, as you did. I do not
remember an incident in the entire period of my contact
with you that any misunderstanding or unfortunate inci-
dents ever occurred, and it is a great pleasure for me
to remember that.
